text: Arhopala philander, is a butterfly in the family Lycaenidae. It was described by Cajetan and Rudolf Felder in 1865. It is found in the Australasian realm.Seitz, A., 1912-1927. Die Indo-Australien Tagfalter Grossschmetterlinge Erde 9 ==Subspecies== *A. p. philander Obi, Bachan, Halmahera, Gebe, Sanghihe *A. p. leander (Evans, 1957) New Guinea, Aru, Misool, Waigeu, Geelvink Bay, Karkar Island *A. p. ander (Evans, 1957) New Guinea *A. p. pratti (Evans, 1957) Mioswar Island *A. p. gander (Evans, 1957) Fergusson Island *A. p. meeki (Evans, 1957) New Hanover *A. p. gazella Fruhstorfer, 1914 Witu Island, New Britain *A. p. eichhorn i (Evans, 1957) New Ireland ==References== ==External links== *Arhopala Boisduval, 1832 at Markku Savela's Lepidoptera and Some Other Life Forms. Retrieved June 3, 2017. Category:Arhopala Category:Butterflies described in 1865
title: Arhopala philander
